paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Brachineurini Edwards, 1937: 146
. Type genus:
Brachineura Rondani, 1840
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. The tribe Brachineurini is characterized by the uniqueness of antenna with 10 flagellomeres and palpus with 3 segments in the subfamily Cecidomyiinae . It is distinguishable from Ledomyiini Skuhravá by its gonocoxite having mediobasal lobe neither sublobing nor clasping aedeagus.

General description. Adult. Palpus with 3 segments, last two segments longer than first one ( Fig. 1 ). Antenna with 10 flagellomeres, each with one neck and only one basal node ( Fig. 2 ). Wing ( Fig. 3 ) setose, usually covered with narrow scales and setose; vein R 1 joining vein C at basal 2/5; vein R 5 bent a little backward, joining vein C at wing apex, or R 5 bent a little forward in the middle, joining vein C distinctly anterior to wing apex; vein Cu forked or not. Tarsal claw ( Fig. 4 ) usually toothed on all legs, sometimes not. Male seventh and eighth tergites both reduced to one strongly sclerotized and linear band. Male genitalia ( Figs 10–11 ). Gonocoxite having undeveloped mediobasal lobe that reduced to one to several setae or prominences, or having one or two developed mediobasal lobes; gonostylus shaped and arched variously; cerci separated to form two lobes; hypoproct simple, or emarginated, or separated forming two lobes; aedeagus shaped variously, sometimes with prominences or other modifications. Female genitalia. Ovipositor short and not protrusible; cerci separated with two short lobes; hypoproct usually broad, simple or separated to form two lobes.

caption.paragraph:
Figures 1–4.
Pennaticoxita tauricornuta
gen. & sp. nov. , male. 1. Palpus, lateral view. 2. Third flagellomere, dorsal view. 3. Wing, dorsal view. 4. Fore acropod, lateral view. Scale bars: 1–2, 4 = 20 μm; 3 = 200 μm.

Figures 5–6.
Pennaticoxita tauricornuta
gen. & sp. nov. , male. 5. Genitalia, ventral view, one gonopod, cerci and hypoproct removed. 6. Genitalia, dorsal view, one gonopod removed. Scale bars = 50 μm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. In the present paper, a subtribal arrangement of the tribe Brachineurini by dividing into two new subtribes including Brachineurina
subtrib. nov.
and Brachyneurina
subtrib. nov.
, is proposed depending on whether male gonocoxite having mediobasal lobe undeveloped or well-developed. According to the subtribal arrangement above, the two genera,
Novocalmonia Ozdikmen
and
Cingola Fedotova & Sidorenko
should be added to the tribe Brachineurini by their 3-segmented palpus and antenna with 10 flagellomeres, which should further belong to the subtribe Brachyneurina by male gonocoxite having densely pubescent and developed mediobasal lobe. Therefore, the subtribe Brachineurina
subtrib. nov.
includes 11 genera and the subtribe Brachyneurina
subtrib. nov.
with 5 genera, with the details given in the key below.

paragraph.emphasis: Key to males of all known genera in the tribe Brachineurini including subtribal arrangement.

subSubSection.paragraph:
5. Gonocoxite having mediobasal lobe with a smaller, slender and sclerotized prominence ..............
Stabiliola Fedotova & Sidorenko
Gonocoxite
having mediobasal lobe only with setae and without sclerotized prominences ....................................
Rhizomyia Kieffer

6. Vein R 5 bent a little backward, joining vein C at wing apex ( Fig. 3 ) ...................................................................................................7 Vein R 5 bent a little forward in the middle, joining vein C distinctly anterior to wing apex ................................................................9

8. Gonostylus with a sub-conical basal lobe protruding outwardly; gonocoxite without any other modifications or lobes ....................... .......................................................................................................................................................
Alatostyla Fedotova & Sidorenko
Gonostylus
normally shaped, without lobes; gonocoxite with a wing-shaped dorsal lobe...........
Pennaticoxita Jiao & Bu
, gen. nov.

9. Gonocoxite inwardly with a stout distal lobe; cerci with a depression forming two slender lobes ...................................
Epimyia Felt
Gonocoxite
without distal lobes; cerci with a deep depression forming two broad lobes ..................................................................10

12. Vein R 5 bent a little backward at distal 1/3, joining vein C slightly anterior to wing apex................................................................. 13 VeinR 5 bent a little forward in the middle, joining vein C distinctly anterior to wing apex ( Fig. 8 ) ................................................. 14

13. Gonocoxite with one or two swollen, unsclerotized and densely pubescent mediobasal lobes.....................
Brachyneurina Mamaev
Gonocoxite
with a sclerotized and snowman-shaped mediobasal lobe ...........................................
Volsatiola Fedotova & Sidorenko

15. Gonocoxite with a sub-conical mediobasal lobe ................................................................................
Cingola Fedotova & Sidorenko
Gonocoxite
with a swollen, hemispheric mediobasal lobe...........................................................
Undoneura Fedotova & Sidorenko
